channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Excessive Traffic caused by Temporary traffic lights, 14th October
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights causing severe delays and backlog of congestion all the way to Rotherhithe with no signs of men at work. This leads to people waiting in a traffic jam over an hour which is so unnecessary. We cannot come out of our side roads because of the blockage. There are no workmen at night nor during the day. Why are they there? They also cause so much delay for bus drivers in transporting people. With the road restrictions due to cycle lane installed makes it very difficult to have a good flow of traffic at all times. It just does not make any sense to have a 3 to 4 way Temporary traffic light system with no works being undertaken. This not only affects the main one way system all around Surrey quays but up to Rotherhithe and in addition, the side roads.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelyn Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of waste, 14th October
item.description:
Several bin bags full of waste. I reported this 2 weeks ago and they were covered in Hackney Council tape but never removed. I received an email saying that the problem had been resolved but it wasn’t. Now they are attracting more rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Casimir Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roads and pavements need sweeping, 14th October
item.description:
There are even more leaves and litter than shown in these pictures by now, the roads and paths need sweeping. They are not cleaning as per the rota. The cemetery trees are a huge problem in terms of leafing and should warrant extra cleaning at this time of year than the average street but they don’t even do the minimum they should. Because of the GP surgery parking along this stretch of road Monday - Friday from 7am-6/7pm means the council should put cones along the road so the roads and cambers can be properly cleaned by vehicle. Or it needs to be done overnight. Or it needs to be done by sending men with brushes who can get around and under parked vehicles. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 14th October
item.description:
This vehicle has been left on the road for months and never been moved. It’s also advertising sales on the highway. It’s also permanently parked close to a bend beside a bollard island in the road at a pinch point outside the GP surgery and because it never moves it’s causing difficulties for traffic when the road is double parked since it’s in that position day and night and never moves out of the way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left in Street following Saturday Market, 13th October
item.description:
Bags of rubbish are left at the junction of North Cross Road and Archdale Road at the end of Saturday's market. These are not cleared - rubbish is only collected from the Lordship Lane end of North Cross Road. Foxes attack the rubbish and spread it all round the nearby pavements and gardens overnight on Saturday and Sunday - this morning the rubbish had still not been cleared

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8-9, North Cross Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old mouldy bed and clothes dumped in fire escape of building, 13th October
item.description:
The mouldy bed appeared on the fire escape of the building on the top floor on Friday October 10th. Clothes have also been thrown out. On Monday 13th of October it was all still there, and what appeared to be human feces next to the bed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urination, 13th October
item.description:
Somebody has urinated right on my doorstep, and also people are doing drugs in the stairways. It’s not a council property but the freeholder and management have abandoned the building and it is not safe now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Bed, mattress and clothes, 13th October
item.description:
Neighbour has dumped this mouldy bed and a lot of clothes in the walkway. In fairness this is in protest at the horrible conditions of his flat, tbh e council is paying for this rent. The landlord should be in prison, disgusting.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
